This profile has to focus on merely genetic/genomic attributes of a genetic observation. Other factors such  as reason for making this observation, conditions assessed, interpretations, etc., should be modeled as profiles (or new resources if necessary) of the appropriate base resources. As an example of why this modeling approach is important, see the next comment line here that focuses on the interpretation attribute. Also, this approach is aligned with the draft Clinical Genomics Domain Information Model.

Proposed Wording: Disallow the use of the interpretation attribute of the base Observation Resource.
Comments: For new types of observations like in genomics, interpretation is typically done by a different performer, using a different method and at a different time than those of the source observation; in addition, multiple interpretations could be created for the same observation, because the knowledge and evidence behind the interpretation process is rapidly changing or controversial and different approaches are available. Therefore, while this bundling is indeed convenient in obvious cases like glucose interpretation, in more complex cases, it promotes pre-coordination constructs, which is bad for analytics (e.g., clinical decision support, clinical quality measurement, etc.).

Proposed Wording: Why assessedCondition does not point to the Condition Resource, or better - to a profile over the Condition Resource?
Comments: This is important, in order to get the full-blown capabilities of Condition AND on order to be aligned with the base semantics of Condition.

Proposed Wording: The link http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/geneticsAssessedCondition is broken.
Comments: Assessed conditions are part of the phenotype possibly associated with the genetic observation and should be modeled after major phenome development efforts in the world.

The "cert" parameter requires more documentation to indicate that it is a keychain (containing a private key). Further, an identifier for the specific Private Key may be required. 

Keychains such as this are not typically available at accessible URLs. Rather, they are embedded in devices (or operating system user profiles for us). I therefore disagree that this is a common enough item of functionality to include in the FHIR Core

I recommend stating that if a signature is required, the client should generate it and upload it to the server and perhaps put the Private Keychain/Passphrase option in a seprate extension/profile.

Comments: The phrase "consumer level" seems misleading, unless the service is truly intended for health care consumers (i.e., patients.)
Summary: Remove the phrase "consumer level" from the introduction.

Existing Wording: A FHIR terminology service is a simply a set of functions…
Proposed Wording: A FHIR terminology service is simply a set of functions…
Comments: There's an extra "a" in here.
Summary: Remove the first occurrence of the word "a" in this sentence.

Existing Wording: Note; "namespace" is used differentyl here from the way it is used by IHTSDO
Proposed Wording: Note: "namespace" is used differently here from the way it is used by IHTSDO.
Comments: There are some problems with this sentence.
Summary: Change semicolon to a colon, correct spelling of "differently," and add a period at the end of the sentence.

Existing Wording: Note; "namespace" is used differentyl here from the way it is used by IHTSDO
Proposed Wording: Note: "namespace" is used differently here from the way it is used by IHTSDO. [wording recommended in comment 3 above]
Comments: This sentence seems like it would fit better in the next section, and it probably needs to be expanded to explain how the term is used differently.
Summary: Move the sentence to section 1.23.6.3.1, and consider expanding it.

Existing Wording: In order to be used with a value set, a code must be defined somewhere. They can be defined…
Proposed Wording: In order to be used with a value set, codes must be defined somewhere. They can be defined…
Comments: The first sentence in the paragraph refers to "a code," but from then on they are referred to in the plural.
Summary: Change "a code" in the first sentence" to "codes."

Existing Wording: a uri that identifies the target value set into which to translate the concept
Proposed Wording: a URI that identifies the target value set into which to translate the concept
Comments: "uri" needs to be capitalized.
Summary: Capitalize the abbreviation "URI."

Existing Wording: An episode of care that this encounter should be recorded against - also the UML Diagram
Proposed Wording:
Episodes of care can overlap and reference common encounters. 

Update UML diagram
Comments: The relationship between an encounter and episode of care is  not parent child.  Mayo has encounters linked to multiple episodes of care.  (see attached document: Episode of Care and Encounters.pdf).
Summary: Two patterns could be considered, encounters pointing to episodes of care or episode of care pointing to contained encounters.  Mayo implmenters have expressed a desire to have episode(s) of care point to associated encounters. They would like to leave encounters untouched when grouping them under an episode of care.

Existing Wording: appended: The composition has been modified subsequent to being marked and/or released as "final" and is complete and verified by an authorized person. The modifications added new information to the composition, but did not revise existing content
Proposed Wording: As currently designed FHIR does not support append relationships between FHIR documents.
Comments:
Appended documents have been previously defined at HL7 as separate documents, that have their own life cycle and providence. 
 FHIR defines an appended as a specialized type of revision of an existing document. 

Re: CDA R2.0 & V3 Medical Records: An addendum is a separate document that references the parent document, and may extend or alter the observations in the prior document. The parent document remains a current component of the patient record, and the addendum and its parent are both read by report recipients. ...

Re: HL7 V2.31
9.1.1.1 Addendum:
An appendage to an existing document that contains supplemental information. The parent document remains
in place and its content is unaltered.
Summary: FHIR has defined Appended documents as a specialized type of amended documents. Appended documents in HL7 V2, HL7 V3 and CDA have always been separate documents that are viewed with the original (parent) document.  If FHIR does not want to support Appended documents, that is fine, however it should not redefine appended.

Existing Wording: Note that the most common resource to use for the content of a section is the List resource.
Proposed Wording: omit
Comments: As per the ballot resolution adopted for the previous ballot, a List resource is the only resource that can be used for the Composition Section.  This sentence is somewhat misleading and should simply be removed.
Summary: removal of the sentence, removes the issue.

Existing Wording: UML indicates that cardinality of List in Section is 0..1
Proposed Wording: UML should indicate that cardinality of List in Section is 1..1
Comments:
List should be a required component of the Section class.  
I can think of no reason to not require List in the Section class.  The list supports emptyReason which would be used when a section contains no entries.
Summary: The List defined the attested narrative content of the Section and in turn the attested narrative content of the document. When a section is empty, it should use the List emptyReason to indicate the reason there is not content.  There seems to be no reason to make it optional.

Proposed Wording: List should be added to the UML diagram for Composition
Comments: As List is a reqiured component of the Section, and as it contains the authenicated content of the section, it should be present on the UML diagram.
Summary: List is a required component of Section (see previous comment) and should be present in the UML and other Resouce Content panes.

Existing Wording: Narrative only sections can be created by setting Content to a resource of the appropriate type and only populating the narrative portion of the resource. If the meaning of the section is such that an appropriate resource does not exist, the List resource should be used. (In some cases, the a resource may have mandatory elements that preclude the resource containing only narrative. This will be addressed in a future release, but for now, List should be used in these circumstances as well.)
Proposed Wording: Narrative only sections can be created by using a List and placing narrative in the List text element.
Comments: The Section List text element should be used to hold the narrative of a section. This should be true for sections with entries, where the narrative is derived from the listed resources, it should be true for sections which contain a mix of free text and entries in a list, where the narrative is the only safe and complete representation of the clincial content of the document, and this should be true for sections which only contain free text narrative.  In that way, a simple rule is created, the authenticated narrative content of a document is found in the Section List text field.
Summary: The current wordng is overly complex, it can all be simplifed by referencing the Section List text as the source of truth and the authendicated narrative content of a document's section.

Existing Wording:
Composition.type: Type of a composition

Composition.class: High-level kind of a clinical document at a macro level
Proposed Wording: Composition.type: Type of a composition
Comments:
It is unclear in the current documentation the relationship and any rules which may apply when using class and type within compositions.  It seems as if the valueset defined for class code is a subset of the codes that could be selected for type.  Type is required, abd class is optional.

Unless a rational is defined for the inclusion of class, it would seem redundant and best expressed as an extenstion.
Summary: No rules for use and explaination as to why two document ontology references are required for Composition.  Lacking a clear need, it would seem that class could be removed from the composition class.

Existing Wording: n/a
Proposed Wording: Unlike CDA, FHIR document context in the Composition class is defined locally to the composition class.  Therefore confidentiality, subject, author, event and event period and encounter expressed in the Composition class apply generally to the composition and not specifically to the contained resources.  As there is no context flow model in FHIR, each resource contained within a composition will express it's individual context.  This is how FHIR supports the safe extraction of clinical content from the Composition.
Comments:
Once we move from V3, we again need to consider the safe expression of context that CDA R2 was required to incorporate as a result of its own ballot process. 

FHIR compositions do not support context flow, so the context expressed in the compostion are not specificly true for the resources found within document.

Existing Wording: n/a
Proposed Wording: Need to add Author to List resource.
Comments: The FHIR List needs to support the optional concept of Author.  As the text element of List is used to represent the authenticatable narrative content of a Section, the author of the narrative needs to be captured.  When the content is a mix of free text and narrative derived from resources contained in the list, then the author may still be required. When the narrative is derived completely from the list of resources, then the author may be omitted, although the software or transform used to create the narrative may want to be tracked.

Existing Wording: Control    0..1
Proposed Wording: Control 0..*
Comments: As valuesets are managed in many contexts, the same valueset may have different identifiers assigned, the current design limits our abilitiy to show that these are the same valueset.
Summary: Request that max count be unbounded

Existing Wording: Control    0..1
Proposed Wording: Control 0..*
Comments: As groups are defined in different systems, different identifiers are created and need to be linked to group definitions.
Summary: Request that max count be unbounded

Existing Wording: Control    0..1
Proposed Wording: Control 0..*
Comments: This limitation will impact our meta data management, as we need to track multiple identifiers for DataElements.
Summary: Request that max count be unbounded

Existing Wording: n/a
Proposed Wording: Group.link is defined to support providing additional context when groups are used (e.g. HATEOAS).  This specification defines some specific uses of Group.link for searching and paging.
Comments: Some groups that will be defined for clinical care improvement or population health would benefit from being able to page though large collections.
Summary: The need to page through large lists in application context, requires that we support paging capabilities.

Existing Wording: n/a
Proposed Wording:
Code  Display   Definition
pager  Pager    The value is the pager number used for contact
Comments: Pager number are utlized at Mayo for this purpose. (10,000 pagers)
Summary: Inclusion of pagers for contact

Existing Wording: n/a
Proposed Wording: Needs to be developed
Comments: Currently Mayo uses three linear measures to define the size and rough shape of a tumor.  The Quanity only support volume measures, which do not suffice for practice needs.
Summary: Need a way to indicate the width, height and depth of a tumor as a clinical finding
Triage Note: this is not in scope for a data type - you'd use specimen?

Existing Wording: eld-5: Either a namereference or a fixed value (but not both) is permitted (xpath: not(exists(f:nameReference) and exists(f:*[starts-with(local-name(.), 'value')])))
Proposed Wording: Remove eld-5
Comments:
Current profile capability seems to limit the ability to uniquely define a constrain sliced sub-element.

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/29969955/fhir-profile-structdef-how-are-children-sub-elements-of-a-named-slice-tied-to
Summary: A requested fix for profiling.

Proposed Wording: Needs to be developed
Comments: In the US, 100% of the Health IT technology which is certified, will likley be required to support both Race and Ethnicity. As such, these elements should be optionally included in the FHIR standard.
Summary: On the Patient Resource we do not see anything for Race or Ethnicity.  These are important demographic data elements and would like them added to the model.

Proposed Wording: Needs to be developed
Comments: On the Practitioner Resource – the definition of a practitioner is quite broad.  Could we suggest relabeling it as Healthcare Employee and then have a sub-element for those providers who are allowed to provide medical care and are ‘billable’ and consider calling that individual a Healthcare Provider?   When we are working on analytic projects, we are typically trying to assess the care that was provided by a physician (or NP, PT, OT) who bills for the service and compare their efforts(including costs associated with care) - with the patient outcomes to derive the value of the care.  This definition is just too broad.
Summary: Need to sort out which healthcare providers are able to bill, vs those who can not.

Proposed Wording: Needs to be developed
Comments: On the Person Resource – same comment as on Patient – think we should have a standard demographic around race and ethnicity.
Summary: Simular to the comment posted on patient.

Proposed Wording: Needs to be developed
Comments: On the Organization Resource – could we recommend adding an attribute in the corresponding Contact for indicating if this organization is the primary contact location?  Helps to identify the role the individual is playing – local or enterprise, corporate office vs subsidiary kind of thing.

Existing Wording:
This resource maintained by the Clinical Decision Support (http://www.hl7.org/Special/committees
/dss/index.cfm) Work Group
Indicates an actual or potential clinical issue with or between one or more active or proposed clinical
actions for a patient. E.g. Drug-drug interaction, Ineffective treatment frequency, Procedure-condition
conflict, etc.
Comments:
It is still not crystal clear if this resource carries the knowledge base for what would constitute a DDI, Drug DX interaction, or tables of maximum doses etc., or an instance of an upcoming contraindication, specific to the patient. From reading this I suspect it is the latter. The former would make sense as a resource. The latter seems 3rd order for this stage of EMR development. And it will also demand more provider time to feed and care for; it would be honey pot for lawyers trying to find some way to blame a bad outcome.
This will also tie in with need to indicate why an alert was ignored. When allergy AND DDI alerts are not really applicable 90% of the time this is a horrible waste of time.
Clinicians could hate it,   I think it should be re thought and put off to the future. Or much better justified.

Existing Wording:
The body position during the observation :
The position of the body when the observation was done,
e.g., standing, sitting. To be used only when the body
position in not precoordinated in the observation code.
observation-delta (extension observation-
delta.html)
Qualitative change or trend in the measurement :
The qualitative change in the value relative to the previous
measurement. Usually only recorded if the change is
clinically significant.
Comments: body position and other specialized things (like cuff size for BP) are usually reported as related observations when they are not pre-coordinated. Requiring these as independent fields in the record will create havoc with reporting in a flow sheet. Either the cell will get very crowded, or the application will have to create a pseudo variable for each body position

Existing Wording:
Procedure.identifier - This records identifiers associated with this procedure that are defined by
business processed and/ or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to
the resource itself is not appropriate (e.g. in CDA documents, or in written /
printed documentation).
Comments: Procedure identifier. Not clear whether this is an unique instance identifier per patient, or some other local identifier or the universal code fro the procedure. Some where I believe you need a code a name and a code syst4em for the procedure. Needs a more elaboration and/or an example

Existing Wording: Procedure.status - A code specifying the state of the procedure record. Generally this will be in-progress or completed state.
Comments: Procedure status: over simplifying. There are lots more possible steps in surgical procedures. in OR,  Prepped,  Anesthesia induced, opened, (skin) closed  to recovery recovery, clear anesthesia. etc.  Don't think you have to define them now, but patients' families want to and those who are tracking efficiencies want to know the status at a more detailed level.

Existing Wording:
Procedure.category - are codes proposed for this field.  Would be nice to see them
Same with type. To know what is really meant
Comments:
are codes proposed for this field?  Would be nice to see them.
Same with type. To know what is really meant.

Existing Wording:
Procedure.type - The specific procedure that is performed. Use text if the exact nature of the
procedure can't be coded.
Comments:
Hard to guess the difference between procedure category and type. 
the def for type =a category of people or things having common characteristics.
The def for category =a class or division of people or things regarded as having particular shared characteristics.

Existing Wording:
Procedure.bodySite - Detailed and structured anatomical location information. Multiple locations
are allowed - e.g. multiple punch biopsies of a lesion.
Comments:
Approach will be more useful than site,  
The names of the procedure will often obviate the need for a specific site. E.g. appendectomy, or Esophagoscopy say the site 
So worry about the 1...1 and how it can always be required.
Also the difference between Procedure.body.site and procedure body.site.site is not at all clear

Existing Wording:
Procedure.outcome - What was the outcome of the procedure - did it resolve reasons why the
procedure was performed?
Comments:
Making this hard codes will make it difficult. Believe there is a required section in procedure notes that might collide with this 
Further the outcome may not be known at the time the data is requested.

Existing Wording:
Procedure.complication - Any complications that occurred during the procedure, or in the immediate post-operative period. These are generally tracked separately from the notes, which typically will describe the procedure itself rather than any 'post
procedure' issues.
Comments:
Strongly believe this has to be narrative. There is no way to corral in codes the complexity of complications and why. 
Would argue for much more use of simple notes in these spaces where we don't have experience with  coding or know if it can be done within time constraints

Existing Wording:
Procedure.relatedItem - Procedures may be related to other items such as procedures or medications.
For example treating wound dehiscence following a previous procedure.
Comments: These related items create a very complicated space . and one that is a social experiment (Don't know how it can get represented as a structure--  very complicated and experimental. Would make these extensions. till there is some experience with the main content

Existing Wording: Procedure.notes - Any other notes about the procedure - e.g. the operative notes.
Comments: these have required structure in the form of sections both from the joint commission AND in meaningful use. More important to represent that than the things that are new inventions.

Existing Wording: Procedure.device - A device change during the procedure.
Comments: Procedure device. The most important devices are those that are implanted. There are lots of requirements around them AND a requirement in MU to code them with UID. This is too vague. It could be talking about the equipment set up for surgery or devices used during surgery.  (e.g.  electrocautery.) Both could be important but they need to be distinguished

Existing Wording:
Procedure.used - Identifies medications, devices and other substance used as part of the

Comments: The name. procedure used, is not evocative of the examples. Would think that medications would be captured by the medication dispensed structures and would not mix them in. this might be focused on the tools used during the procedure but not implanted

Existing Wording: Detailed Descriptions for the elements in the DiagnosticOrder resource.
Comments:
Don't see anything related to what was timing/quantity in V2. People do order chest x-rays every AM  and Blood gases every  hour. 
If this is not supported, a discussion of why not and whether or how repeating orders will be accommodated. (I can see that they may not be restful). But don't just ignore it and create frustrated users trying to figure out how to accommodate such orders. Presume there is a way to do it with drug orders and nursing orders (Which I can't find anywhere. )

Existing Wording: DiagnosticOrder.identifier - Identifiers assigned to this order by the order or by the receiver.
Comments: Presume this is a distinct instance identifier that relates in some way to the  placer order # of V2. If so some historical linkage is in order so existing V2 users can equivalence what is in their experience to FHIR approach. The filler placer #s were the keys to managing V2 test orders.  Any connects will be appreciated by users

Existing Wording:
DiagnosticOrder.clinicalNotes - An explanation or justification for why this diagnostic investigation is being
requested.
Comments:
This has usually been called reason for study or indication. 
Don't think the current name conveys that. For lab tests in the US it has to be coded. And if the dx codes don't line up wit those acceptable to 3rd parties, they don't get paid. There does not seem to be an option for a coded reason for study. For radiology a narrative reason is usually required.

Existing Wording:
DiagnosticOrder.supportingInformation - Additional clinical information about the patient or specimen that may
This information includes diagnosis, clinical findings and other observations.
Examples include reporting the amount of inspired carbon dioxide for blood
gasses, the point in the menstrual cycle for cervical pap tests, and other
conditions that influence test interpretations.
influence test interpretations.
Comments:
Mix up here. Should be amount of  inspire O2.
 However there is also collision here with ask at order entry questions which are stored as discrete observations and returned with the result.    Same with the date of menstrual cycle.  So there is some schizophrenia here. Or you are saying to enter discrete observations here. It is not clear. Should stay with ask at order entry for labs and not slide over to full narrative. If not you should confess there are two ways of doing this and explain when to do which. These free from narrative

Existing Wording:
DiagnosticOrder.item - The specific diagnostic investigations that are requested as part of this
request. Sometimes, there can only be one item per request, but in most
contexts, more than one investigation can be requested.
Comments:
Not clear what the item is versus the code. The code will include a name and coding system (No). What  additional info does the item add, and how is it represented. Don't see a data type.  
Oops now I see that is the mother object for the more specific that follow. Don't have to respond to my comment.

Existing Wording: Detailed Descriptions for the elements in the DeviceMetric resource.
Comments: This looks very specific to the IEEE 11073 - which is OK, but should be stated more clearly I The fact that content is tied to NIST means this is IEEE 11073. All of these variables have LOINC equivalents and the device should convert them to LOINC before sending them to an EMR. The terms include lab tests and vital signs among other things.

Existing Wording:
DeviceMetric.type - Describes the type of the metric. For example: Heart Rate, PEEP Setting,
etc.
Comments: This is getting close to a clinical observation

Existing Wording:
DeviceMetric.identifier - Describes the unique identification of this metric that has been assigned by
the device or gateway software. For example: handle ID. It should be noted
that in order to make the identifier unique, the system element of the
identifier should be set to the unique identifier of the device.
Comments:
IEEE  11073 has two ways to identify a variable. 1) a code that begins with MDC and 2) a numeric code for the same variable. Not crystal clear which one they are referring to. But the example shows a pure numbers 
These serve exactly the same role as LOINC codes  and are IDs for observations (Mostly)

Existing Wording:
DeviceMetric.unit - Describes the unit that an observed value determined for this metric will
have. For example: Percent, Seconds, etc.
Comments: This is really the unit of measure and IEEE is faithful to UCUM .That should be asserted here

Existing Wording:
MetricUnit: Required (terminologies.html#required): RTM Management
Service (https://rtmms.nist.gov/rtmms/index.htm#!units) (Describes the
unit of the metric)
Comments: if you look at NIST you fill find UCUM codes AND their own MDC codes. Not clear which one they are pushing here. At present I believe that NIST content regarding the 11073 is only available via a password. That might interfere with HL7 rules about access.  NIST has agreed to include LOINC codes that correspond to the MDC codes

Existing Wording:
DeviceMetric.OperationalStatus - Indicates current operational state of the device. For example: On, Off,
Standby, etc.
Comments: if you look at NIST you fill find UCUM codes AND their own MDC codes. Not clear which one they are pushing here. At present I believe that NIST content regarding the 11073 is only available via a password. That might interfere with HL7 rules about access.  NIST has agreed to include LOINC codes that correspond to the MDC codes

Existing Wording:
DeviceMetric.Color - Describes the typical color of the representation of observations that have
been generated for this DeviceMetric.
Comments: needs more description. Doubt they are talking about color as in the light spectrum, so need something that ordinary folks can understand

Existing Wording:
DeviceMetric.measurementPeriod - Describes the measurement repetition time. This is not necessarily the
same as the update period.
Comments: Believe this is really the sampling rate of a signal. If so that should be stated more clearly

Existing Wording:
DeviceMetric.calibration - Describes the calibrations that have been performed or that are required to
be performed.
Comments: what is the data type?

Existing Wording: DeviceMetric.calibration.state - Required (terminologies.html # required)
Comments: can't link to any of these coding tables to understand what they are

Existing Wording: DeviceMetric.calibration.time - the time last calibration has been performed.
Comments: don't see a data type. Has to be a time stamp. no?

Existing Wording:
A few observations (e.g. Apgar store) may have both a value
and related observations (for Apgar, the observations from which the
measure is derived).
Comments:
Are you talking about the score associated with each Apgar question,  (which could be carried in the ordinal but that should be called a score to follow HL7 v3 and many conventions 
What you mean by related question is very unclear. Apgar is usually reported as panel of 4 items with one representing the total score. 
Is the related queue
Before the first ballot we had a long discussion about having two values in one value field, Don't think that is what you are talking about here but it is not clear

Existing Wording:
A CodeableConcept with just a
text would be used instead of a string if the field was usually coded, or if the
type associated with the Observation.code defines a coded value.
Comments: very unclear. is this in case it is Coded with exceptions variable gets a free text answer.. Need an example

Existing Wording:
Observation.dataAbsentReason - "Null" or exceptional values can be represented two ways in FHIR
Observations. One way is to simply include them in the value set and
represent the exceptions in the value. For example, measurement values for
a serology test could be "detected", "not detected", "inconclusive", or "test
not done". The alternate way is to use the value element for actual
observations and use the explicit dataAbsentReason element to record
exceptional values. For example, the dataAbsentReason code "error" could be
used when the measurement was not completed. Because of these options,
use-case agreements are required to interpret general observations for
exceptional values.
Comments: test not done was reported as part of the status in V2. Would make sense to stay with that both for continuity and because it is NOT really an answer

Existing Wording: Observation.comments - May include statements about significant, unexpected or unreliable values, or information about the source of the value where this may be relevant to the interpretation of the result.
Comments:
V2 NTE has a way to distinguish between boiler plate- comments that are about the test in general which are not a function of the patient or the patients test results versus those that are patient specific. 
These distinctions are important for creating compact summaries- which would typically exclude the boiler plate but keep the patients specific information
This seems to be arguing for the latter only (which is good). But it a little soft could be clearer and it would be helpful to V2 users to relate this to the NTE observation comments and the field that distinguished between the ( I think) 3 classes of comments which many systems might be using specialization to the specific patient or the observation obtained. 

These are not related to the specific results. These comments seem to exclude such boiler plate

Existing Wording: Observation.issued - The date and time this observation was made available.
Comments: to whom. Think it is usually when made available to the clinical providers. It may be available earlier within lab but not yet "verified"

Existing Wording: Observation.status - The status of the result value.
Comments: where is the list of statuses needed to understand this field

Existing Wording: Observation.reliability - Not all results are completely reliable, and some are still reported anyway.
Comments:
This is a very ill defined statement. What kind of reliability, Test/retest, precision. Everything has an error band around it. So this statement is almost a truism an not helpful, because nothing will be perfectly reliable. Reliability is a continuous variable Saying OK won't tell me  a thing
Further the reliability, sensitive etc. etc. is usual a function of the test and the lab not of an individual observation
Think this is not a useful field and should be removed. Or used for to report error bands around numeric results.

Existing Wording: Observation.identifier - A unique identifier for the simple observation.
Comments: add "instance" to end after "observation".  Might comment on the scope of uniqueness.  globally unique or unique in the context of the sources

Existing Wording: Observation.subject - Comments: Indirect characteristics may be those of a specimen, fetus, other observer (for example a relative or EMT),
Comments: insert "donor" after fetus

Existing Wording: Observation.subject - Indirect characteristics may be those of a specimen, fetus, other observer (for example a relative or EMT), or any observation made about the subject.
Comments: The distinction between the patient's own value  for an observation versus that of the fetus, or the donor is often specified in the Observation code

Existing Wording:
Observation.specimen - Also note that observation resources are often used in contexts
that track the specimen explicitly (e.g. Diagnostic Report).
Comments: change "are often" to "may be"

Existing Wording: Observation.device - The device used to generate the observation data.
Comments: should be able to accommodate the UID which is rapidly coming in the US from the FDA and for which Meaningful use regulations have some demands.

Existing Wording:
Observation.related - Related observations - either components, or previous observations, or
statements of derivation.
Comments:
More should be said about grouping and how these represent panels  in the discussion of related observations. I didn't get the main usage for them until I read orders and all of the other content

This should be explained here, And the examples shown are not ideal unless one slips in the word panels to help explain them
Observation related needs more thought. Blood pressure systolic and diastolic have no more special relation ship than serum sodium and potassium and chloride . (which can generate the anion gap) Or the pressure in the R and L eye.
However except for  general panel, there is hardly any need for these special relationships to be instantiated as structures because they can be constructed as reports based on knowledge about the variables that is independent of the specific patient or results. he because they are true generally and and be organized as desired at reporting time. via information in the master files. Having a field for their use will just encourage extra work.

Existing Wording: Device.udi
Comments:
Good to see the UDI in the device resource. But the UDI does not define a "type" of device. It identifies the specified device and model number from the manufacturer. It is more like an NDC code than an RXNorm. code. 
Further devices made up of parts may have many UDIs, one for the pacemaker and one for each of the leads.  Am not sure how this all works but would need to have a hierarchical structure to carry all of the parts when they are not pre-packaged as one product 
There is another resource called a device component. Which probably achieves this- but some explanation of how and through what attribute the device connects to its components.
Believe the data about devies will be look up able at NLM

overview. 
I had assumed this would be the record  used to define the patients active (or past) medication profile. In many cases the information would come from a hospital discharge record (e.g.. from cCDA, or possibly exchange with a pharmacy.  A list of these things would end up being the reconciled medication list. 
However nothing in the text makes it clear that my assumed purpose is the intended purpose. So need some clarification about where such information would go
If this is intend to be the mediation profile then I worry that it is too focused on patient delivery of that information. It could actually come from the EMR of the prescriber, or other sources named above.
But I see no reason to constrain it to records obtained from the patient or another clinician. Open that up to any source- but then need a bit more information on the source

Existing Wording:
The difference between a code system and a value set is an important distinction that is often
missed by implementers, since the difference is often overlooked in system design. For instance,
it's not unusual to see a system table that is a mixed list of codes, containing some LOINC codes
and also some additional in-house codes. Quite often, there is no explicit differentiation between
them; only the fact that a code happens to look like a LOINC code betrays its origin.

The variable that is being reported in an observation (as in LOINC) often carries a list of possible values. and would  often obviate the need for  an value set identifier. The free standing answer lists are extremely rare in nature ( like free electronics).   Most important however it to keep track of what value set- answer list  was used when completing a form. There is more than one way to do that, by value, by reference. Via a 2nd observation in the case of observation answer lists.  These should be discussed and considered. 
Use of a URL for a permanent record is a bit scary considering how often URL links are lost

Existing Wording:
Observations are a central element in healthcare, used to support diagnosis, monitor progress, determine baselines and patterns and
even capture demographic characteristics. Most observations are simple name/value pair assertions with some metadata, but some
observations group other observations together logically, or even are multi-component observations. Note that the DiagnosticReport
(diagnosticreport.html) resource provide a clinical or workflow context for a set of observations. Expected uses for the Observation
resource include:
Vital signs: temperature, blood pressure, respiration rate
Laboratory Data
Imaging results like bone density or fetal measurements
Devices Measurements such as EKG data or Pulse Oximetry data
Clinical assessment tools such as APGAR
Personal characteristics: height, weight, eye-color
Social history: tobacco use, family supports, cognitive status
Core characteristics: pregnancy status, death assertion
Comments: good

Existing Wording:
The observation resource has the following aspects:
status (mandatory) - all users of observations SHALL be sure of the status of the observation
reliability - provides an estimate of the degree to which quality issues have impacted on the value of an observation
code (mandatory) - describes what was observed. This is the 'name' in the name/value pair assertion pattern used in this
resource
identifier - Unique identifier for this particular observation so it can be recognized in all contexts where it is represented
value - the actual value that was observed
related observations - Other observations that are components of this observation, or provide supporting information, context or
warnings about this observation
subject,.bodySite[x] - the patient, or group of patients, location, or device, that this observation was made on. Note that group of
patients is most often used in veterinary care. For individual patients, the location on the body may also be specified, though this
is often implicit in the Observation.code
applies[x] - The time or time-period the observed value is asserted as being true. For biological subjects - e.g. human patients -
this is usually called the "physiologically relevant time.
interpretation, comments, and reference range: information to help understand the observed value
method, issued, performer - additional information about how the test was performed that may help understand the observation.
The method is often implicit in the Observation.code
Typically, an observation will have either a value or component observations, and not both.
Comments: not bad idea to have possible. but there is no tradition for routine reporting of this as a discrete fields

Existing Wording: Typically, an observation will have either a value or component observations, and not both.
Comments: oops thought we got rid of this. Could induce 290/180 as bp.  Why not distinguish the observation  header

In some cases, such as when source data is coming from a v2 feed, a system may not have information that allows it to distinguish
diagnosis, allergy and other "specialized" types of observations from lab, vital sign and other observation types intended to be
conveyed with this resource. In those circumstances, such specialized observations may also appear using this resource.

(clinicalimpression.html)

(contraindication.html)

(questionnaireanswers.html)

Comments:
not at all clear which of these are  master files( Knowledge bases) versus patient specific data The distinction should be asserted in the description.  The medications resource makes it clear that it is a knowledge base, not patient specific entity. (Labs and tests and nursing orders need the same kind of master file. (And don't think its a data element anymore than  medications are) 
Contra-indications strike me as something that is also a master file and applies in general not something that is specific to the patient. 
 needs clarification
Clinical impression as a resource is problematic and should be removed. Its only clear use is as one section of a SOAP problem oriented note. It is not an independent entity. Any more than the 3-4 parts of radiologist reports, Reason for study, findings, impression_ are .  Further lab tests routinely include an summative element that is labeled an impression or interpretation, and it is just another observations. If readers of this standard believe they all have to be impression resources it will add complexity with no utility. ~~
Risk assement is a new invention in the sense of being a separate thing. Suspect it does not deserve its own separate resource and will create lots of work for people trying to decide what goes where.   Some lab test , e.g. prenatal screening reports values that are literally risk as does the framing ham risk equation. There is no reason to distinguish these structurally from bread and butter observations, they could be culled out when/if needed by looking at the master file.

The example Mayor report descries what was found as "wild type" See below The blue text is inserted to show how these are sometimes being reported with LOINC labels in HL7 messages 
Example report on mayo web site 
EGFR Gene, Mutation Analysis, Tumor
RECEIVED: 06/11/2013 12:04 REPORTED: 06/11/2013 17:05
Specimen Tissue-Tumor MCR
Specimen ID 1062170 MCR
Order Date 11 Jun 2013 13:12 MCR
Reason for Referral MCR
 Evaluate tumor DNA for presence of a mutation in exons 18-21
 of the EGFR gene.
Method MCR
 Microscopic examination was performed by a pathologist to
 identify areas of tumor for enrichment by macro dissection.
 A PCR based assay employing allele specific amplification
 was used to test for the presence of 
21666-3  EGFR gene mutations tested for  29 mutations within  exons 18-21 of the EGFR gene (G719A, G719S, G719C in exon
 18; small deletions in exon 19; T790M, S768I, and small
 insertions in exon 20; and L858R and L861Q in exon 21).
 Mutation nomenclature is based on GenBank accession number;
48013-7  Genomic reference sequence NM005228.3. (This may not be the right format which I think would be NM_005228.3 
Result MCR
 Tumor type: Lung Adenocarcinoma
-
21665-5  EGFR gene mutations found EGFR status: Wild-type
Interpretation MCR
 THIS IS REALLY BOILER PLATE COMMENT:Current data suggest that patients with non-small cell lung
 cancer with mutations in the tyrosine kinase domain (exons
 18-21) of EGFR may respond to EGFR tyrosine kinase inhibitor
 therapies. Thus, the absence of an EGFR mutation within
 this tumor specimen suggests that these therapies may have
 limited therapeutic value for this patient.
 The predictive value of EGFR testing applies to EGFR
 tyrosine kinase inhibitor therapies, not to other
 therapeutic agents.
 This result does not rule out the presence of a mutation
 that may be present but below the limits of detection for
 this assay (approximately 5%) or an EGFR mutation that is
 not part of this panel. It is estimated that this panel
 detects greater than 95% of pathogenic mutations (exons
 18-21) associated with response/resistance to EGFR-targeted
 therapies.

Existing Wording: • Data Element: question about specificity
Comments:
we have to allow different types with different amounts of specificity , but be sure that the message contains what ever is needed. Implies that the actual answer list used to answer a question should always b available either by value or reference. Also will require that the units of measure be in a standard form and a data element can only carry different UoM that are commensurate. And that  can be transformed The genesis of the absolute ideas about data elements comes from an organization that has big funding but not much success in generating adoption of their approach.And that  can be transformed among commensurate UoM. The genesis of the absolute ideas about data elements comes from an organization that has big funding but not much success in generating adoption of their approach.
The connection to ISO 11179 is deeply problematic, because the data elements as conceived in FHIR are migratory—like free electron’s  – that is they can exist in many contexts and generally move from a message to a data base when received from an external source. And it can be any arbitrary data base.   But ISO 11179 is intended to define elements in  one specified data base. The data element gets tied to a particular property and object of that data base- and that object and property are defining characteristics of the data element.  (11179 works fine in that context_  But it creates a huge impedance mismatch when you deal with “fee electron” data elements that have no home data base. Creates crazy realities.
Another and deep problem with data elements is the name and the confounding with the use of “data element" as building blocks of resources. Those are more like data base data elements. The things in questionnaires should have a different name.  In the survey literature they are most commonly called data items.  Using the same name for different things always leads to confusion. 
     From the frame work :
 1.7.1.1 Framework  
FHIR is based on "Resources" which are the common building block for all exchanges. Each resource has the following common features: 
• A URL that identifies it
• Common metadata
• A human-readable XHTML summary
• A set of defined common data elements

This specification is framed as an international specification but includes numerous references to US-specific legislation.  All references to US-specific legislation must be removed or there should be a balance where examples are drawn from legislation throughout the world.

This profile has no introduction providing scope.  The short names violate rules requiring adding context beyond the resource + element name.  There are no examples.  The bindings are all generic contract bindings, not consent-specific.  There is no way this profile can be implemented as is and making it implementable would be so substantive as to be unfair to suggest it has received DSTU review.  This profile needs to be dropped to Draft.  Hopefully it can be ready to go DSTU by release 2.1
Either fix this or drop the messaging piece to Draft

Existing Wording: udi:string
Comments:
The UDI does not itself identify the repository or jurisdiction. When using a datatype which has a 'system' the jurisdiction can be held in the system. This will be key for users to be able to know which repository to check for further information as the FDA will not be the only jurisdiction on the planet and with medical tourism people will bring non-FDA UDIs into the FDA jurisdiction.
The alternate of creating a separate field for each UDI issuing jurisdiction is I think bad design and an unnecceasry burden on implementers.

Should gender be renamed to administrativeGender given its required binding to the AdministrativeGender value set?  One might need to add biological sex in a later profile, in which case it may be more clear if this gender is labeled as what it actually is (administrative gender).
Suggest either allowing a dateTime or clarifying how time of birth, when available, should be communicated.  See, for example, the QICore Patient birthTime extension.

Suggest re-reviewing whether overloaded attributes should in fact be separate attributes.  E.g., Patient.deceased is allowed to be both boolean and dateTime.  It seems like there should be a Patient.deceased with a boolean and a Patient.deceasedDateTime with a dateTime.  Not sure the cost (more complicated processing logic, difficulty of mapping to a logical model where the attributes will likely be separate) is worth the benefit (use of a shorthand notation to reduce number of attributes).
Triage Note: you get the cost either way

Comments: Suggest re-reviewing whether structures with Element data types should be Resources or Data Types.  Rule of thumb could be that if it is likely to be used in more than one resource, it should be a Resource.  E.g., Patient.contact -- why is this an Element, when Patient.address is a Data Type?  Couldn't Patient.contact be generalized when used in other settings, like for a Provider (e.g., escalation needed for sending alerts, etc.)?  Also, profiling such structures requires profiling the entire containing Resource, which seems suboptimal.
Summary: Review example with group
Triage Note: They should not be resources, but they could be data types. However we've found that a they need to be highly similar before being a data type works. Why would you profile just the contact part?

Existing Wording: than
Proposed Wording: then

Comments: The definition is ambiguous.  What does "nominated care provider" mean?  Is it the primary care provider?
Can there only be one managing organization? How does this address a continuum of care use case? Should this be left to provenance and not be directly in the patient resource?

Why are some relationships to other Resources explicilty named in the Resource or in a profile (e.g., Patient.managingOrganization), with the relationship type defined in the attribute name and definition, whereas in other cases, the relationships use a generic triple approach with a coded relationship type (e.g., Patient.link), in which the relationship type is managed through value sets?  It seems inconsistent without a clear justification.  Would suggest using the former approach consistently.
Triage Note: In most cases it depends whether a/ the type is  extensible or not, and b/ how long the type list is. If the type list is not extensible and short, then the former is appropriate. If it's extensible, then the former approach cannot be used. If there's a complex instead ofa  single reference, then the former approach should not be used. How short the list should be before the former approach is used is left to the discretion of the committee

Comments: Billing data are very commonly used.  Recommend making clear how/where billing data are available using FHIR, and how to distinguish that data from non-billing data (e.g., how to distinguish ICD encounter diagnoses billed with an encounter, vs. encounter diagnoses that were captured in an EHR but which may or may not have been billed).

Many exisitng qualtiy measures require the ability to specify that an encounter diagnosis (asssumed to be "reason" in this case) was a primary or secondary diagnosis.  Also, sometimes it is required to differentiate between facility billing and professional billing codes.  Support for this is needed to meet current-day use cases.  How are these attributes supported?

Proposed Wording: Condition.firstEncounter
Comments:
Without reading the description, one would think this attribute can refer to any encounter where the condition was noted (e.g., in the case of an encounter diagnosis).  Suggest renaming the attribute to clarify what it actually refers to.

Also question why this is in a FHIR core resource.  Do 80% of current systems capture this information?

Existing Wording: Estimated or actual date the condition/problem/diagnosis was first detected/suspected.
Proposed Wording: Date when the condition/problem/diagnosis was asserted.
Comments: If wish to capture date first asserted, should add a sibling attributed called dateFirstAsserted.

Shouldn't this be a required rather than optional attribute as it is critical to understanding the type of condition we are talking about, and where it came from?  Also, shouldn't this be a isModifier == true?  Also, how would we distinguish between a Problem List entry, an Encounter Diagnosis, and a billed Encounter Diagnosis?

Do most systems actually capture and distinguish a Working vs. Confirmed condition?  Can you provide guidance on what should be used as the value when there is no explicit information captured in a system as to whether it's Working vs. Confirmed?  I assume it should be a default of Working unless there has been some information captured indicating it is Confirmed?
Please clarify when/how Range is supposed to be used for this attribute.  E.g., do you mean use -10yr to -15yr to mean it was sometime 10 to 15 years ago?
Why does one use dateTime and the other use date?  Was this intentional?

Is this in 80% of EHR systems?  Isn't it usuallly just in notes?  These seem reasonable for anticipatory purposes, but doesn't it break FHIR's 80% approach for core Resources?  If these are included here, shouldn't we consider other non-80% but anticipatory/forward-thinking attributes elsewhere?
Aren't these all similar items?  Shouldn't they all be called target or detail?

Recommend allowing for structures in notes that contain an optional type.  Generally, should be 0..* when used rather than 0..1.  If the cardinality is 0..1, and there are multiple notes, the receiving application will be responsible for parsing them.
Triage Note: Don't understand. Can you explain more detail.

Comments: Recommend creating distinct resources for supplies directed towards an individual (e.g., supplying a wheelchair to a patient) and stocking supplies not targeted to a patient. Also, there should be a request type resource for each as well as a statement type resource. That is, I am requesting a wheelchair for patient X or a wheelchair was supplied to patient X on March 31.
Recommend adding Timing.repeat.offset to capture radiotherapy and chemotherapy protocol requirements surrounding offsets in cycles. For more information, see Tracker 6255.
Triage Note: Discussion in committee. Is this really part of  the data type? Would often not be appropriate where the data type is used

Comments: ContactPoint should include a 'preferred=true/false' attribute in case a number of contact points share the same period but one is preferred by the provider. This is important for communication routing scenarios.
Triage Note: Really? Is this core? Do systems actually collect multiples of each? I haven't seen it?

Comments: ContactPoint should provide a 'rank' attribute in case different communication modalities should be attempted in a particular order. E.g., try my cell first, SMS second, followed by email or office phone.
Triage Note: Really? Is this core? Do systems actually collect multiples of each? I haven't seen it?

Comments: Currently the cardinality is 0..1. Should it also support areas? In this case, a polygon may be specified and cardinality should be relaxed to 0..*. Not sure if that is in scope for this resource.

Practitioner.communication is modeled differently from patient.communication. Yet, I am not sure there is strong justification for the difference. I recommend that both be modeled in the same way. After all, a provider may speak different languages and have a preferred one.
Suggest renaming to 'bodySite' or 'affectedSite'. Location is overloaded with the physical location where something is done/observed such as a facility, etc....
Suggest renaming to 'targetBodySite'. There may be other body sites associated with procedure (e.g., approachBodySite)
Suggest renaming to 'targetDevice' or something that makes clear that it is not a device used in the procedure but the device targeted by the procedure.
Suggest renaming to usedItem to more clearly indicate what this attribute refers to.
Procedure has evolved since ProcedureRequest was drafted. Suggest re-aligning the two resources to account for changes in one, relevant to the other.
Procedure.notes is 0..1. ProcedureRequest.notes is 0..*. Suggest updating both resources based on comment number 19.

Based on the definition of "comments", shouldn't this be a modifying attribute?  Is this really a note, in which case should it be called a note (note is used elsewhere). Please see comment number 19 regarding cardinality.
Should 'applies' be renamed to 'physiologicallyRelevant[x]'. While short names are good, they must also be more descriptive.
Should 'issued' be renamed to 'recordedTime'
How do you record when the observation was taken?  Should there be a 'madeTime'?

In the value set ObservationRelationshipType, there are two entries: 'has component' and 'has member'. Do we need to distinguish the two? It might lead to coding errors. While V3 made the distinction, the suggestion is not to carry this forward and use only one of the two.

The medication prescription status should be updated to align with other request resources. For instance, I might wish to state that a medication prescription is proposed by a CDS system, planned, etc...

Please review the pharmacy core profile (pharmacy-extensions-spreadsheet.xml) to determine whether some of the extensions proposed should be moved up to core. These concern primarily volume meds dosing.
Cardinality should be 0..* instead of 0..1.  E.g., may prescribe an ACE inhibitor for both diabetes and hypertension.
These structures appear in a number of places. These should be candidates for types or resources. Please refer to comment number 4
Cardinality is 0..1 but should be 0..*.  A procedure can be in multiple categories.  E.g., a laproscopic cholecystectomy is both a GI procedure and a laproscopic procedure.
Could there be more than one information source?
Recommend re-name to followUpInstructions
Recommend renaming to administrationSite
Recommend this be 0..1 instead of 1..1.  This information may not always be available.
Cannot be read.  Therefore cannot review and comment.

Comments: There are many types of readmissions.  Having a simple boolean flag doesn't make sense.  E.g., There are 7 day readmission, 30 day readmissions, 90 day readmissions, readmissions for all causes, readmissions for specific reasons, etc.  This should be removed, a type should be added, or individual readmission types should be specified.

Existing Wording: The referral request that this encounter is satisfies (incoming referral).
Proposed Wording: The referral request that this encounter satisfies (incoming referral).
Comments: Extra 'is'.

The required value set bindings should be revisited, or the attribute should allow multiple values.  E.g., Outpatient and Emergency are not mutually exclusive.  Neither is Inpatient and Emergency.  Should be able to distinguish between non-Emergency outpatient, Emergency visit only, Emergency visit leading to inpatient, and inpatient only (direct admit).  Also, should allow support for phone visit if virtual visit is included.  This is the most common of these "non-at-site" visits.

Suggest making cardinality 0..* as I may have multiple dietary preferences/restrictions and there may not always be a pre-coordinated term to accommodate the requirement.  E.g., I may be allergic to nuts AND I may be allergic to dairy.

Comments: Many of the attribute names seem to prioritize brevity for understandability.  Recommend making attribute names descriptive enough to not require looking at documentation to understand what they refer to.

Comments: Where are the present-on-admission diagnoses?

Comments: How is a diagnostic report not a diagnostic report?

There is a need for a document describing how the most common types of data communicated in health care should be represented using FHIR.  For example, the vMR Logical Model had this type of a section.  E.g., how should you represent -- billing data, laboratory results, problem list data, etc.  This should be provided rather than having users read through each appropriate-sounding resource and trying to figure this out (e.g., looking through both Condition and Encounter resources to try to figure out how Encounter Diagnoses should be represented).
Triage Note: I think is what ResourceGuide.html is going to try to be, but it's a massive challenege because the implementation space is so broad. Please contribute to resourceguide.html

Comments: It seems to imply that an observation has to be contained within a DiagnosticReport.  E.g., that if I have a Complete Blood Count or a Hemoglobin A1c, that it needs to be in a DiagnosticReport rather than directly accessible as Observations and nested Observations.  It seems like this adds an added layer of unnecessary complexity.  Please clarify or otherwise address.
Referrer is ambiguous, why not referingPhysician
Recommend renaming to AllergyOrIntolerance to more clearly represent what it is

Shouldn't the base resource, and not just the event, have a severity?  E.g., eating peanuts generally results in severe hives, without a record of a specific event leading to that reaction (I don't think that's commonly recorded).

This should be an AdverseEvent resource, because there can be AdverseEvents outside the context of an Allergy or Intolerance (e.g., a fall).  When such AdverseEvents are represented separately, there will be high overlap and duplication unless this has been made its own resource, with profiles developed accordingly (e.g., to specify that an offending agent is required).
Reading through the resource description, it's still unclear how to represent an appointment request.  Please clarify.

Please clarify the boundaries/relationship for ReferralRequest and an appointment request.  E.g., my patient has diabetes and needs to be seen by an ophthalmologist to have a retinal exam.  How do I do this?  Which FHIR resource should I use?  It seems like it could be a ReferralRequest for an ophthalmologist, OR an appointment request with the ophthlamology clinic.
The notion of a provider, in a role, for a period of time seems like a common pattern. Should this be pulled out into a participation type.
Please populate the actual value set or at least provide a good set of examples based on the logical specification of the value set.

Why was this resource created and what is the use case?  Also, who submitted this resource?  Is this meant to record the results of, e.g., drug-drug interaction alerts and responses to them?  Otherwise, this type of information seems to be knowledge that is not tied to a specific patient.

Both Questionnaire and QuestionnaireAnswer refer to Question. Suggest making it a resource since a question could be reused between questionnaires. For instance, in the VA LEGO structured documentation approach, LEGOs represent question-answer-choice pairs that can standalone from the form that may include them.

The chosen approach to extensions will lead to unnecessary significant increased size of FHIR artifacts. It is expected that a fair number of extension will be required for a particular use case that is not generic. Each single data element that is to be extended will have to have the full URI specified. In addition to increasing the size, it also makes the resources significantly more difficult to read and understand. I would recommend strongly considering the W3C Resource Description Framework (RDF) standard for creation of extensions in XML and JSON LD for representation in JSON. Both of these methods are more lean and readable than the current proposal.

Existing Wording: the resource did not exist prior to the update, and the serer does not allow client defined ids
Proposed Wording: the resource did not exist prior to the update, and the server does not allow client defined ids
Comments: server is spelled wrong

Existing Wording: When resources are returned as part of a bundle, there is no ETag, and the versionId of the resources is used directly.
Proposed Wording: When resources are returned as part of a bundle, there is no ETag, and the versionId of the resources are used directly.

Existing Wording: Resources that have been deleted may be "brought back to life" by a subsequent update interaction using an HTTP PUT.
Comments: It is not clear how resource contention is to be handled whena delete action is performed. This should be thoroughly explained. For example, what is system A and System B both retrieve the latest version of a resource. System A, using the existing Etag, deletes the resource, and subsequently System B, using the same ETag updates the resource. Will the resource be "brought back to life", or does the delete operation somehow update the ETag and thus the server returns a 412. If the later is the case, how does a system "get the new ETag to bring a resource "back to life"
Triage Note: Good question. Have to research etags on deleted resources. Will try it at connectathon

Existing Wording: If the client wishes to have control over the id of a newly submitted resource, it should use the update interaction instead.
Comments: It is not clear as to what is meant here. More explanation should be provided. Given that all of the data resides on the server, which is managing all of the data directly, it is not clear why the client should ever have control over the meta id for a resource.

Existing Wording: The conditional create operation allows a client to create a new resource only if some equivalent resource does not already exist on the server.
Comments: Allowing a client to make the decisions for the server is problematic as the client may not be aware of all of the conditions and requirements of the server. The server should also be allowed to determine itself what would be considered a duplicative entry regardless of whether the client uses a conditional create or not (If this is allowed by the specification, it should be explicetely stated.
Triage Note: well, the server is allowed to do so, but it can only return an error. I think that it's not good for the server to pull a fast one on the client in the interests of it's own data integrity

Existing Wording: Servers SHALL be replace all matching links in the bundle, whether they are found in the resource ids, resource references, url elements, or
Proposed Wording: Servers SHALL replace all matching links in the bundle, whether they are found in the resource ids, resource references, url elements, or

Existing Wording:
needs-action
Needs Action

Proposed Wording:
unknown
Unknown

Comments:
Action may or may not be needed for partipants whose attendance status is unknown. E.g. if they were optional for the appointment no action may be needed. 
Change "needs-action" to simply be"unknown".
